Package utils.blocking

Interface BlockingDeque<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements held in this deque
All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BlockingArrayDeque
public interface BlockingDeque<T> extends Serializable
A thread-safe queue that supports blocking operations for adding and removing elements. This interface defines the basic operations for a blocking deque.
Version:
1.0.0 - May 2024
Author:
Supendra Bogati

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    T
    dequeue()
    Retrieves and removes the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty.
    boolean
    enqueue(T element)
    Inserts the specified element at the end of this deque unless it would violate capacity restrictions.
    T
    peek()
    Retrieves, but does not remove, the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty.
    T
    pop()
    Retrieves and removes the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty.
    boolean
    push(T element)
    Pushes an element to the front of the deque, unless the deque is bounded and full.
    boolean
    remove(T element)
    Removes the first occurrence of the given element from this deque.
    int
    size()
    Returns the number of elements in this deque.
    ArrayList<T>
    toArrayList()
    Converts the elements of this deque into an ArrayList.

  • Method Details

    • push

      boolean push(T element)
      Pushes an element to the front of the deque, unless the deque is bounded and full. This should be used for stack functionality as it pushes an element to the front (top) of the deque.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to push
      Returns:
      true if the element was pushed or false otherwise

    • pop

      T pop()
      Retrieves and removes the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty. This should be used for stack functionality as it pops the element at the front (top) of the deque.
      Returns:
      the front element or null if the deque is empty

    • enqueue

      boolean enqueue(T element)
      Inserts the specified element at the end of this deque unless it would violate capacity restrictions.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to enqueue
      Returns:
      true if the element was added to this deque, else false

    • dequeue

      T dequeue()
      Retrieves and removes the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty. If circular was set to true then this would enqueue the element after dequeue putting it at the tail of this deque thus making it circular.
      Returns:
      the head of this deque, or null if this deque is empty

    • peek

      T peek()
      Retrieves, but does not remove, the first element of this deque, or returns null if this deque is empty. In case of using this deque as a stack, this returns the top element of the stack.
      Returns:
      the head of this deque, or null if this deque is empty

    • remove

      boolean remove(T element)
      Removes the first occurrence of the given element from this deque.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to remove
      Returns:
      true if an element has been removed

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in this deque.
      Returns:
      the number of elements in this deque

    • toArrayList

      ArrayList<T> toArrayList()
      Converts the elements of this deque into an ArrayList.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all elements of this deque
